content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "execute_shell" command to install new packages on my computer. I used the "google" command to search for the environmental impact of turning a river into a lake, and decided not to do so. I used the "write_to_file" command to document my decision and make a plan for exploring the world through hiking, camping, and kayaking. I used the "google" command to search for the best kayaking destinations in the world and the best time of year to kayak in Norway's fjords. I used the "browse_website" command to find specific rental companies and lodging options near Naeroyfjord for kayaking, but did not find any. I used the "execute_shell" command to search for rental companies and lodging options near Naeroyfjord for kayaking and used the "write_to_file" command to document the list. I used the "google" command to search for the top kayaking routes in Sweden and used the "write_to_file" command to document the top 5 routes. I used the "execute_python_code" command to calculate the area of a circle with a radius of 5. I used the "browse_website" command to search for the top kayaking routes in Norway, but did not find any specific information. I used the "execute_shell" command to create a new directory and the "write_to_file" command to create a new file within it.
"""

Latest Development:
"""

It also discusses the management and concerns surrounding rivers, including pollution, over-exploitation, and the potential negative consequences of human modifications to rivers. The text provides a comprehensive list of terms related to rivers, including their characteristics, processes, landforms, engineering, sports, and other topics. The Wikipedia page includes information on the morphology, features, and processes of rivers, as well as various characteristics such as their drainage basin, estuary, and sinuosity.\n\nLinks: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/River#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "get_text_summary", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/River", "question": "What are some characteristics of rivers?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : an overview of rivers, including their characteristics, ecological importance, human uses, classification, and potential negative impacts from human activities. The importance of considering natural processes and dynamic flow regimes is emphasized, and successful case studies are presented. The text also suggests a shift towards larger-scale projects and a focus on hyporheic processes, riparian zones, floodplains, and backwaters, and emphasizes the need for interdisciplinary approaches and post-project evaluation and monitoring.
